front.title: MIPv6 bootstrapping solution for split and integrated scenario using DHCPv6

abstract.t: In mobile IPv6 (MIP6), there is a need to transfer the home agent address, home IP address to the mobile node when the mobile node is in the foreign network. This problem is referred to as bootstrapping. This document defines a Bootstrapping Information Server Function (BISF) and Bootstrapping Information Client Function (BICF). The BICF uses AAA messaging for obtaining the bootstrapping information from the BISF. Such a mechanism can be used by either the integrated or split scenarios.
